name: 'Schoolhouse Rock!' Online Quiz | Schoolhouse Rock | 20 Questions

questions.text: What was the name of the adverb store?
questions.explanation:
Lolly's.

	More precisely, Lolly's Inc. It was run by Lolly Sr., Lolly Jr., and Junior's little boy. Writer and performer Bob Dorough is the voice of all three generations of Lolly's. His voice was sped up to vary the pitch. (Song title 'Lolly, Lolly, Lolly, Get Your Adverbs Here')

questions.text: In the song about pronouns, which of the following was *not* a character?
questions.explanation:
Zachary Amadeus Barbarella.

	And they found a kangaroo, an aardvark, and a rhinoceros. (song title 'Rufus Xavier Sarsaparilla')

questions.text: Repeated line in Conjuction Junction: 'Conjunction Junction, ________________?'
questions.correct: what's your function & whats your function
questions.explanation:
what's your function & whats your function.

	'I've got and, but, and or. They'll get you pretty far.'

questions.text: Who is the main character in 'Elementary, My Dear'?
questions.explanation:
Noah.

	This song was about multiplying by two, a perfect fit for the man who gathered two of every beast.

questions.text: In 'A Victim of Gravity', the main character is best described as:
questions.explanation:
a greaser.

	The band that recorded this song, the Tokens, also recorded the hit song 'The Lion Sleeps Tonight'.

questions.text: At the end of 'I'm Just A Bill', what happens to Bill?
questions.explanation: He becomes a law.

questions.text: In 'A Noun is a Person Place or Thing', on what street does Mrs. Jones live?
questions.explanation:
Hudson St.

	'She sent her dog to bark at my brother and me. We gave her dog a big fat bone, And now he barks at Mrs. Jones.'

questions.text: Who was Lucky Seven Sampson in the song of the same name?
questions.explanation:
a rabbit.

	When Lucky Seven makes 42 'clickety clicks' on the fense (7x6), the wall in the background is filled with grafitti names of all the people who worked on the animation.

questions.text: In the Multiplication Rock series, what number does *not* have a song?
questions.explanation:
13.

	Zero has 'My Hero, Zero', 11 has 'The Good Eleven', and 12 has 'Little Twelvetoes'.

questions.text: In 'Conjuction Junction', who was seen down by the lake?
questions.explanation:
a duck and a drake.

	I wonder as I walk by what they would say if they could speak, although I know that's an absurd thought: 'Conjunction Junction, what's your function? '

questions.text: In 'Interjections!', which of the following was *not* an interjection used?
questions.explanation:
Fiddlesticks!.

	They used Yow! Ouch! Well! Oh! Hooray! Awww! Eeek! Rats! Wow! Hey! Hallelujah! Yeah! and Darn!

questions.text: In 'Verb: That's What's Happening', how was Verb personified?
questions.explanation:
a superhero.

	Verb was an action hero. (Get it?)

questions.text: In 'Unpack Your Adjectives', what adjectives did the turtle use to describe a bear that he and the backpacker ran into?
questions.explanation:
a big, ugly bear.

	Trick question: the backpacker said, 'He was a hairy bear! He was a scary bear! ' The turtle later said, 'Whoa! Boy, that was one big, ugly bear!'

questions.text: In 'Sufferin' 'Till Suffrage', name one of the three suffragettes referred to:
questions.correct: Susan B. Anthony & Julia Howe & Lucretia Mott & Susan B Anthony
questions.explanation:
Susan B. Anthony & Julia Howe & Lucretia Mott & Susan B Anthony

	Susan B. Anthony lectured on women's rights and on abolition, and, with Elizabeth Stanton, secured the first laws in the New York state legislature guaranteeing to women rights over their children and control of property and wages. Julia Howe wrote and lectured in behalf of woman suffrage, black emancipation, and other causes. She also wrote 'The Battle Hymn of the Republic'. Lucretia Mott began her women's rights speeches after being forced to leave an anti-slavery convention because of her gender.

questions.text: In the song about the solar system, what is the main character's name?
questions.explanation:
Interplanet Janet.

	'Interplanet Janet, she's a galaxy girl, A solar system miss from a future world.' (song title 'Interplanet Janet')

questions.text: What two songs had mostly black characters?
questions.correct: 'Verb: That's What's Happening' and 'I Got Six'
options: 'Rufus Xavier Sarsaparilla' and 'A Victim of Gravity'
questions.explanation: 'Verb: That's What's Happening' and 'I Got Six'.

questions.text: In the song about multiplying by 5, what game is being played?
questions.explanation:
Hide-and-Seek.

	'It' counts by fives up to 100 and 120. (song title 'Ready Or Not, Here I Come ')

questions.text: Which of these animals wasn't in 'The Four-Legged Zoo'?
questions.explanation:
snake.

	Snakes don't have legs! They wouldn't be in The Four-Legged Zoo! 8-)

questions.text: What favor exchange did the Earth boy offer to Little Twelvetoes?
questions.correct: help multiplying by 12 for help multiplying by 10
options: help finding friends on each other's worlds
help finding his sister for help finding missing child
help fixing truck for help fixing spaceship
questions.explanation:
help multiplying by 12 for help multiplying by 10.

	'If you help me with my 12's, I'll help you With your 10's, And we could all be friends. ' (song title 'Little Twelvetoes')

questions.text: According to the America Rock song, what 'relative' helped inventors through history?
questions.explanation:
Mother Necessity.

	Because the song required four singers, all of whom worked in different locations, this song was recorded in different bits on both coasts and then mixed together in New York. (song title 'Mother Necessity') (Final note: Lyrics and some Interesting Info trivia taken from 'SchoolHouse Rock: The Official Guide'.)
